entry.title: Re: Mass Assets Scrapping - With posting on a specific ac...
entry.content:
Hi @G_hind01 ,

Try below options.

 

ScenarioApproachHow It WorksProsCons
1. Create Temporary Account Determination (AO90) Variant and Mass ScrapChange AO90 for specific Account Determination key (e.g., Z1) and assign these assets temporarilyAssign affected assets to a new Account Determination key using AS02 ‚Üí General Tab; then post scrapping via ABAVNNo manual posting; system drives correct G/LRequires master data change + careful controls
2. Use Manual Journal Entry After Scrapping (Reclass)Scrap assets normally using existing AO90 setup; then move gain/loss to another G/L via FB50 / F-02System posts gain/loss to AO90 G/L, then you manually post a reclassificationEasiest, safest, no config changeTwo-step process; more audit trail entries
3. Use Mass Transaction ABLDT (Post Scrap via Legacy Transfer Logic)Use ABLDT (with reason for scrapping) for one-time exceptional postings, specifying custom G/LCan override G/L because legacy transaction bypasses AO90No config changeNot recommended for operational use; audit sensitive
4. Use BAPI for Custom Posting (Z-program)Develop a small Z-program using BAPI_ASSET_RETIREMENT_POSTThe BAPI allows passing a custom gain/loss G/L in accounting tablesCan fully automate and specify G/LRequires development effort
5. Temporarily Change AO90 for the Account Determination and Switch BackChange AO90 for specific asset class ‚Üí perform mass scrapping ‚Üí revert AO90Mass changes possibleNo master data on assets changedVery sensitive ‚Äî affects all assets in the class; only safe if asset class is exclusive

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: ABAP BTP Environment - Application Log Objects - You are not authorized to display the specified log
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In the ABAP BTP environment, we can create Application Log Objects, add messages, and save them successfully. However, our users currently lack the authorization to view the logs we‚Äôve created.

Example:

METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
    TRY.

        " Create log object
        DATA(lo_log) = cl_bali_log=>create( ).

        " Create and set header
        DATA(lo_header) = cl_bali_header_setter=>create( object      = 'ZZLOG'
                                                         subobject   = 'CONN'
                                                         external_id = '12345'
        )->set_expiry( expiry_date       = CONV d( cl_abap_context_info=>get_system_date( ) + 7 )
                       keep_until_expiry = abap_true ).

        lo_log->set_header( lo_header ).

        " Classic Message
        DATA(lo_msg) = cl_bali_message_setter=>create(
            severity   = if_bali_constants=>c_severity_error
            id         = 'ZZMSGCLS'
            number     = '001' ).

        lo_log->add_item( lo_msg ).

        " Save logs
        DATA(lo_log_db) = cl_bali_log_db=>get_instance( ).

        lo_log_db->save_log( lo_log ).

        " Get the handle
        DATA(l_handle) = lo_log->get_handle( ).

        out->write( |Log created: { l_handle }| ).

        " Read messages from handle
        lo_log = lo_log_db->load_log(
                   handle           = l_handle
                   read_only_header = abap_true
                 ).

        DATA(lt_items) = lo_log->get_all_items( ).

        LOOP AT lt_items ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_item>).
          out->write( <ls_item>-item->get_message_text( ) ).
        ENDLOOP.

      CATCH cx_bali_runtime INTO DATA(lo_cx_bali_runtime).

        out->write( lo_cx_bali_runtime->get_text( ) ).

    ENDTRY.

The method call:

        " Read messages from handle
        lo_log = lo_log_db->load_log(
                   handle           = l_handle
                   read_only_header = abap_true
                 ).

throws the exception with the text: You are not authorized to display the specified log

Does anyone know if there is any other way to read the logs?

Thank you,
Christian

entry.title: SAP numbering again ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs jump!
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been a while, and I thought I was grown out of this, but I can‚Äôt get out of the habit.
I wonder why software component SAP BASIS has jumped up to version 8.16 recently.

Reminds me of my old blog posts on SAP numbering:

  • Why SAP ERP 6.0 EHP6 contains SAP BASIS 7.31 - SAP Community
  • SAP versioning, part 2 (why EHP7 contains SAP APPL... - SAP Community

Product version SAP S/4HANA 2025 (in short: 2025) is available since October 2025, and it contains software component version SAP BASIS 8.16. I must have been inattentive for a moment, since I was still considering it in the number range ‚Äú7-something‚Äù. OK, kids grow up and get older, but S/4HANA 2023 was based on 7.58 ‚Äì now it is on 8.16. This is a jump, isn‚Äôt it?

Subtracting 16 from 58 provides an interesting but misleading answer. Of course, you already see the real reason: my inattentive phase took too long, the distance between 2023 and 2025 is longer than before. SAP S/4HANA (Cloud Private Edition and on-prem) switched from a yearly to a bi-yearly release cycle, with three Feature Package Stacks in-between. But SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is delivered every quarter, and with this, it is eating up the numbers for the SAP BASIS versions.
As this is sorted out, let us look onto another component: the kernel. SAP Kernel 9.16 is used for 2025. Not a typo: SAP Kernel 9.16 and SAP Basis 8.16. 2023 uses SAP Kernel 7.93, and a move from 7.93 to 9.16 is even a bigger jump than the one SAP BASIS did!

Again, my inattention was probably the reason for my astonishment: I ignored SAP Business ByDesign (in short: ByD), another ABAP-based business solution from SAP that uses SAP Kernel and SAP BASIS. ByD has eaten up the kernel numbers in the 8-range, so 2025 jumped to ‚Äú9-something‚Äù. Jump 2 is clarified.

Let‚Äôs see what comes next to challenge my numbering skills.

entry.title: Re: Wait Time not available in production order operation...
entry.content:
Good day @RobC99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more information.

Production Order (Version 2), Operations for Production Order (Version 2), CDS Views, APIs for Manufacturing

The entity set A_ProductionOrderOperation includes various key fields but not the field for Wait Time. The API focuses on order-execution data and doesn‚Äôt yet expose all scheduling- relevant parameters. The options provided by the Clean-Core approach is to either follow the analytical approach by using Released CDS views, Use Released API for scheduling data or use a Custom Logic BAdI.

To summarise, the current API does not expose the wait time field because it focuses on operational execution data. Consider using the CDS view I_ProdnOrdOpSchedgParams (includes manual overrides), which you can join with I_ProductionOrderOperation. If API access is required, you can implement a Custom Logic BAdI to append the field to the existing endpoint or monitor the upcoming API_PRODUCTION_ORDER_3_SRV which will natively include it.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Calculation of YTD Last year in the model - SAP ANALY...
entry.content:
@Miotisoa 

You can do it in 2 steps using story calculations.

First calculate the YTD by creating the restricted measure using dynamic date .

 

Now create another restricted measure using the previous restricted measure and now shift the date by previous year.

 

In Model level you can not nest YTD with any other dynamic time shift formulas. You can create the YTD in the model using YTD formula.

YTD(<measure>,[d/date])

Then use the story calculation  step 2 to restrict it to previous year.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: How to approach job profile builder for SF learning?
entry.content:
Hello @CassMontagner 

Hope you are doing well.

JPB in this specific scenario won't be possible to use. See below:

Assignment Profiles allow you to use User Profile information to build the target population. While attributes/Competencies are not associated with user profiles in Learning, JPB/TIH data won't be supported in the Assignment Profile rules.

As an alternative, other user related fields could be used to give you more granularity when building the profiles like Country/Region, Division, Job Location, Custom Fields, etc.

Hope this information helps you to move forward. Let me know if you have follow up questions.

-Geison

entry.title: Re: How to synchronize a big table in a replication syste...
entry.content:
I would recommend you specifically mention in this answer the specific scenario in which the 'Scenario 6' applies.

Namely, this approach is for the initial materialization of a table-level repdef. This approach would not work for a resync operation, nor would it work for an initial materialization if managing replication via Warm Standby (WS) or Multi-Site Availability (MSA).

For DBAs with a history of (Sybase) Repserver experience this is nothing new, but for new(er) Repserver DBAs the nuance (table-level repdef vs MSA vs WS) is often misunderstood in which case this answer could lead to some unwanted headaches and issues.

entry.title: Re: How to synchronize a big table in a replication syste...
entry.content:
A few caveats ...

  1. OP mentions the source and target are running under different OSs; while not an issue if we're talking big-endian-to-big-endian, or little-endian-to-little-endian, a cross-platform dump-n-load (eg, big-endian-to-little-endian) would require more details beyond 'dump the primary database'.
  2. OP is talking about materializing a single table so dropping and recreating an entire database repdef, followed by a full database dump, may be excessive.
  3. A database dump-n-load usually requires some advanced planning and/or advanced cleanup after the load is completed and before transactions are applied by the DSI; in particular, server level user/role ids must be synced with database level user/role ids, and any inter-database references (either by name or id) may need to be synced

entry.title: How to integrate Cloud ALM with Integration Suite - Easy and Updated Steps
entry.content:
In this article, I will show how to integrate SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Integration Suite step by step. This setup allows you to connect your integration scenarios with Cloud ALM monitoring to gain full operational visibility and control.

SAP Cloud ALM is SAP‚Äôs cloud-based solution that helps you not only to implement a new system, but also monitor, operate, and optimize your SAP landscape. It provides tools for implementation tracking, process monitoring, alerting, and event management, all from a single cloud platform.

SAP Integration Suite is SAP‚Äôs enterprise integration platform that enables you to design, build, and manage integrations between SAP and non-SAP systems, both cloud and on-premise.

By connecting Integration Suite with Cloud ALM, you can:

  • Automatically monitor message and error data from integration flows to Cloud ALM.

  • Monitor end-to-end interfaces and exceptions in one central dashboard.

  • Simplify troubleshooting with unified alerts and logs.

  • Improve operational efficiency through proactive issue detection and resolution.

This integration helps facilitates operations, improve transparency, and enable a more reliable and connected SAP landscape.

I will divide into 2 parts: BTP Integration Suite Configuration and SAP Cloud ALM Configuration

Part 1 ‚Äî BTP Level Configuration (Integration Suite Side)

1. Access and Roles

  • Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  • Make sure your Global Account and Subaccount are active.
  • Verify that Cloud Foundry is enabled and that you have the following roles:
    • Org Manager
    • Space Developer
    • Subaccount Administrator

2. Provision Integration Suite

  • Go to your Subaccount ‚Üí Instances and Subscriptions.
  • Ensure Integration Suite is provisioned.
    • If not: click Create ‚Üí Integration Suite ‚Üí select plan (standard or enterprise) ‚Üí Create.
  • Open the Integration Suite Launchpad to confirm access.

3. Create Service Instance

If you‚Äôre using the Integration Suite for API-based connections, ensure the Process Integration Runtime or Integration Suite API instance exists.

  • Go to: Service Instances ‚Üí Create ‚Üí Process Integration Runtime
  • Plan: api-access or standard
  • Confirm creation.

4. Create Service Key

To allow the Integration Suite to authenticate with Cloud ALM via OAuth:

  • Go to: Service Instances ‚Üí [your instance] ‚Üí Create Service Key
  • Copy and save:
    • clientid
    • clientsecret
    • tokenurl
    • url

Part 2 ‚Äî Cloud ALM Level Configuration

5. Access Landscape Management

  • In SAP Cloud ALM, go to
    Landscape Management ‚Üí Services & Systems ‚Üí Add New Service
  • Fill out All Properties which corresponds to your Cloud Integration

Click on save and the system shall be displayed according to below screen:

Click on Add Endpoint and fill out with the properties of your secret key JSON File
After adding the endpoint, go to Integration & Exception Monitoring ‚Üí Configuration and enable Data Collection for your system. Data will appear after a few minutes.

Congratulations, you finished the setup process!

Now, Go to Health Monitoring or Integration & Exception Monitoring and add the newly added system scope:

You may reproduce anything on the Integration Suite side in order to generate data, select the corresponding Time Frame and check the generated data being displayed in Cloud ALM.

Additional references: 
SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)

Health Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)

entry.title: Open to all developers: Building the Future of Enterprise AI with SAP Build
entry.content:
Open to the Developer Tools Your Teams Already Use

At SAP TechEd 2025, we demonstrated that we are bringing enhancements to SAP Build that open new opportunities for developers to build, extend, and deploy enterprise-ready applications faster and more intelligently.

Over the past months, we‚Äôve laid out the foundation: We announced at SAPPHIRE this year that we will provide developers with the tools to create AI Agents with Joule Studio. With the availability of  MCP Servers (Model Context Protocol) , developers can build faster and deploy their apps more easily on BTP.

This means your preferred agentic AI development tools, such as OpenAI Codex, Windsurf, Cursor, Cline, Claude Code, and more, can now connect to our local MCP servers. They can produce reliable and accurate code using SAP frameworks like CAP, Fiori, Mobile, UI5 and others. And within Visual Studio Code, you can now access SAP Build‚Äôs productivity capabilities directly - creating UIs to define and view data models with ease. Looking ahead, we will extend this further through the Open VSX registry, bringing the same experience to Visual Studio Code ‚Äìbased IDEs like Cursor, Windsurf, and others.

Build AI Agents Natively with Low Code in Joule Studio

As enterprise applications evolve, developers need intelligent components that can reason, act, and collaborate autonomously. That‚Äôs where the new Agent Builder in SAP Build‚Äôs Joule Studio comes in.

Design, Deploy, and Manage AI Agents End-to-End

SAP Build‚Äôs Joule Studio provides a complete environment for designing, deploying, and managing enterprise-grade AI agents. It allows agents to access business data securely, automate workflows, and integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems ‚Äì all with no-code simplicity and a Vibe Coding approach using Joule to specify and build the agents.

Adding to the existing experience of Joule Studio of building agent skills, we are extending the Agent Builder capabilities further with key features like:

  • MCP Integration: The Model Context Protocol enables agents to communicate seamlessly with external tools and APIs, bridging SAP‚Äôs enterprise systems with the open ecosystems.
  • Agent-to-Agent Collaboration (A2A): Build multi-agent environments where agents can collaborate to solve complex tasks ‚Äî like finance agents reconciling transactions based on insights from supply chain agents.
  • Intent-based Development: The new Vibe Coding approach combines prompt-based logic design, visual flow orchestration, and system-triggered automation. Developers can define agent behavior in natural language, see logic visually, and deploy instantly.

Joule Studio provides the governance, lifecycle control, and scalability enterprises require, without compromising openness or developer autonomy.

Build with what you know

Developers can now run local MCP servers, allowing full agentic development, testing, and orchestration within their preferred agentic AI assistants. We have provided MCPs for CAP, Fiori, UI5 and Mobile and will soon include ABAP.

With this, SAP is expanding the SAP Build ecosystem with an open approach that meets developers where they are. SAP Build‚Äôs local MCP servers enable agentic development with developers‚Äô preferred AI coding tools, while ensuring enterprise-grade governance and clean-core compliance. With the SAP Build Full Stack Extension Package and the Service Catalog Extension for Visual Studio Code, developers can seamlessly extend SAP Build‚Äôs tooling‚Äîcombining intuitive graphical design with hands-on coding in VS Code.

In addition, VS Code support for AI-assisted ABAP development is coming soon. Inside VS Code, developers will be able to:

  • Generate boilerplate ABAP code and test cases.
  • Optimize CDS views and performance-critical logic.
  • Enforce clean core best practices and architecture standards.

Bringing AI to Your Digital Workspaces

Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI assistant, is now integrated into SAP Build Work Zone standard and advanced  editions, SAP Start, and SAP Mobile Start.  Integrating Joule into SAP Build Work Zone brings a unique value to users by effortlessly connecting data from multiple backend systems into a single interface. By providing answers and insights from any supported system, Joule eliminates the need to switch between tools. This empowers every business user to stay informed with all relevant information and applications in one place, their central entry point.

More than that, with embedded Joule, teams can generate comments, create workspace content, and summarize documents in seconds. Collaboration gets quicker. Work stays focused.

Joule ensures every AI interaction adheres to enterprise security standards‚Äîand now delivers this through role-based document grounding. Responses are dynamically restricted to each user‚Äôs authorization level, safeguarding data privacy and compliance across departments and industries.

Simplifying SAP Build Licensing and Packaging

Innovation should never be gated by complexity. SAP has simplified how developers and partners access and extend the SAP Build and Joule ecosystems.

Developers can now build and ship ABAP extensions that are cloud-ready, upgrade-stable add-ons for SAP BTP. These add-ons are designed to maintain compatibility across SAP versions and releases ‚Äî reducing maintenance overhead while ensuring enterprise reliability.

Access to SAP Build including Joule Studio and Joule for Developer is included in S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private Edition and the new Business Suite Packages.

Licensing options are available via Subscription, BTPEA, and CPEA models.

Partners can obtain free SAP Build licenses through the SAP Build TDD license, supporting innovation and rapid prototyping across the ecosystem.

Empowering developers in the AI-Native, Open Development Ecosystem

SAP Build‚Äôs commitment to openness goes beyond interoperability ‚Äî it‚Äôs about empowering developersto innovate with the tools, languages, and architectures they already know.

Here‚Äôs what that looks like in practice:

  • Build in VS Code with SAP extensions and local MCP servers.
  • Develop in ABAP with AI-powered assistance and visual CDS modeling.
  • Design and deploy AI agents in Joule Studio that connect across SAP and non-SAP landscapes.
  • Integrate Joule into your central entry point to reach across your SAP ecosystem.

It‚Äôs a unified environment where AI, development, and enterprise-grade governance converge ‚Äî ensuring every innovation is production-ready from day one.

Upcoming Events

Join us at these upcoming events to dive deeper into SAP Build, learn from experts, and continue building your skills.

entry.title: Re: When export table to Excel in SAC , what filters will...
entry.content:
Why Some Filters Appear or Do Not Appear in the Appendix When Exporting to Excel in SAC

When a table is exported from SAC to Excel, the Appendix page only shows filters that directly influence the data behind the table. This often includes page filters and certain input controls, but not all of them.

In your case, Company Code and Profit Center are page filters, while Posting Period is a calculation input control. The reason Posting Period appears in the Appendix is because it changes the query results, so SAC treats it as part of the data context.

On the other hand, filters such as Ledger or other unused input controls may not appear if they are not actively linked to the widget or model. SAC only lists filters that affect the query output. Story-level filters that are not connected to the underlying data source are ignored.

To put it simply:

  • Filters that impact the data query will show in the Appendix.

  • Filters that do not change the query or are not linked to the widget will not appear.

If you want consistency, make sure all input controls are bound to the same model and actually influence the table‚Äôs data.

entry.title: Re: Partner profit center xxxx is locked for 2024/06/19
entry.content:
This error means the profit center you are posting to is either locked or not valid for the posting date of the GR.

You can check it in KE53 by entering the profit center number. Look at the validity dates and see if it covers 2024/06/19. Also check if the ‚ÄúLocked for posting‚Äù indicator is set.

If the profit center is expired, extend the validity in KE52. If it is locked, remove the lock.
Sometimes the system derives a wrong partner profit center, so also check the material or cost object assignment.

Once the profit center is valid and open for that date, the GR will post successfully.

entry.title: Direct Debit Advance Notices
entry.content:
This blog post introduces the procedure of creating an advance notice to inform payers about future direct debit payment collection in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition. It is aim for the usage related to direct debit mandates.

What is Advance Notices?

Before the collection of the future direct debit payments, the payee can send an advance notice to inform the payer about the payment collection.

Prerequisites

Before creating direct debit advance notices, you must complete the following customizing activities:

  1. Setting up the number ranges for advance notices
  2. Activating the advance notice function
  3. Setting up the lead days for the advance notices
  4. Configuring the output of advance notices, including form templates, email templates and form template for correspondence
  5. Maintaining the email address for the business partners that receives the advance notices

In the following activities, we introduce the procedure in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition.

Setting up the number ranges for advance notices

This activity allows you to set up a range of numbers within which the advance notices are valid.

  1. In your configuration environment, find the Enter Number Ranges for Direct Debit Prenotifications (ID: 106939).
  2. Create entries of numerical ranges between which the direct debit advance notices are valid.

Activating the Advance Notice Function and Setting up the lead days for the advance notices

In this activity you activate the direct debit advance notice function and setting up the lead days to determine the execution day for the payment collection.
You must complete the following activations in different configuration steps:

  • Define General Settings (ID: 106087)
    Select the Activate Direct Debit Advance Notice checkbox.
    Choose a calendar ID and lead days. By doing so, you can set up the execution day for the direct debit payment collection.
    Note: Ensure that there is a minimum number of days between the notification of the upcoming direct debit and its collection day. 
  • Define Payment Methods (ID: 101952)
    In this activity you activate the direct debit advance notice for the payment method by countries/regions.
    In the Payment Methods under Required master record specification group box, select the Direct Debit Prenotification checkbox.
  • Define Specifications for Paying Company Code (ID: 101251)
    In this activity you activate the direct debit advance notice for the specific company code.
    Select your company code and double click.
    In the Specifications for SEPA Payments/Direct Debit Mandate group box, select the Direct Debit Pre-notification checkbox.

Output Management preparation

You have configured the output of the advance notices with the following steps.
Note: You have to activate the Output Management (1LQ) scope item.

  • Maintain Form Template (app: F1434)
    In this app you can either use the SAP pre-defined template FIN_CA_DDM_ADVANCE_NOTICE for advance notices or you can copy the SAP delivered template, based on which create your own form template.

    Download the dunning notice template and open it in the LiveCycle Designer for the modification.
    Note: You can install Adobe LiveCycle Designer in Install Additional Software app.

  • Assign Form Templates (ID: 102313)
    After you prepare your own form template and upload it, you must activate it in this configuration step.
    Assign the Application Object Type: FKC_DDM_ADVANCE_NOTICE and the Output Type: DDM_ADVANCE_NOTICE to your form template.

     

  • Assign Email Templates (ID: 101945)
    In this activity, you can assign the email template that you have configured the texts and branding according to your needs. For more information about how to configure your own email template, see Configuring Email Templates.
    Assign the Application Object Type: FKC_DDM_ADVANCE_NOTICE and the Output Type: DDM_ADVANCE_NOTICE to your email template.
  • Define Form Template for Correspondence (ID: 102223)
    In this activity assign the form template and the email template to a correspondence type. You can determine which correspondence is included when generating and printing documents.
    Select 0048 - Direct Debit Pre-Notification as your correspondence type and assign your form template and email template IDs.

Procedure of Creating Direct Debit Advance Notices

If you activate advance notice for a payment method, you cannot generate payment through the Payment Run/Debit Memo Run app for this payment method unless the advance notice for this payment has been created. To create an advance notice for the payment, see the following steps.

  1. Use the Prenotify Direct Debits app to create advance notices.
    In the Job Template field, select FI-CA: Direct Debit Prenotification.
  2. Use the Payment Run / Debit Memo Run app to post documents of direct debit payments.
    You must complete the following action to include the open items in payments:
    • Select the Pre-notified Items checkbox
    • Fill in the "Execution Date" field

Optional: Adjust Number of Days between Notification and Direct Debit Payment Collection

If the number of days between the advance notice and the payment collection date are insufficient, those pre-notified items can be skipped when running the payment runs in this app.
In the following section, SAP provides the Cloud Business Add-In (BAdI) implementation for this scenario.
As a key user, you can use the cloud business add-in (BAdI) to implement your own logic. Before using the cloud BAdI, ensure that you have assigned the business role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC.
Note: Regarding of extensibility options for developers, go to Business Accelerator Hub and search for Adjust Payment Data (for Customer).

  1. Open Custom Logic app.
  2. Select ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù and select FKK_EVENT_0610.
  3. Enter the Implementation Description.
  4. Publish.
  5. Open Code Editor.
  6. Select edit and enter your own logic.

You can reuse the following coding and adjust based on your business requirements.

‚ÄØ‚ÄØMETHOD‚ÄØif_fkk_sample_0610_badi~execute. 
 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØDATA:‚ÄØls_messages‚ÄØTYPE‚ÄØLINE‚ÄØOF‚ÄØmessa_kk_gfn_t. 
 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØBAdI‚ÄØimplementation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØDirect‚ÄØDebit‚ÄØMandates‚ÄØ-‚ÄØAdvance‚ÄØNotice 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØcheck‚ÄØnumber‚ÄØof‚ÄØdays‚ÄØbetween‚ÄØNotification‚ÄØand‚ÄØCollection‚ÄØDate 
 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"Select‚ÄØPre-Notified‚ÄØItems"‚ÄØoption‚ÄØis‚ÄØactive 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØIF‚ÄØcapaymentrunparameter-prenotifieddrctdebitsareseld‚ÄØEQ‚ÄØspace. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØRETURN. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØENDIF. 
 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØLOOP‚ÄØAT‚ÄØcadocumentitemstobepayed‚ÄØASSIGNING‚ÄØFIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_op>). 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØCompare‚ÄØCreation‚ÄØDate‚ÄØof‚ÄØPayment‚ÄØRun‚ÄØ(‚ÄØDPAYC-ERDAT)‚ÄØand‚ÄØ‚ÄØExecution‚ÄØDate‚ÄØcalculated‚ÄØin‚ÄØevent‚ÄØ657‚ÄØ/‚ÄØSSCUI‚ÄØ106087-"Lead‚ÄØdays"‚ÄØfor‚ÄØadvance‚ÄØnotice 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØIF‚ÄØcapaymentrunadminrecords-creationdate‚ÄØ<‚ÄØ<fs_op>-casepaprenotifexecutiondate. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØdeactivate‚ÄØitem 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ<fs_op>-itemisactivated‚ÄØ=‚ÄØabap_false. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØset‚ÄØexception:‚ÄØ‚ÄØPre-Notification‚ÄØwith‚ÄØUnsuitable‚ÄØDate 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ<fs_op>-capaymentexceptionreason‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ'053'. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ"‚ÄØadd‚ÄØinfo‚ÄØmessage 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessageidentification‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ'FKKID_DDM'. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagenumber‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ'073'. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagetype‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ'I'. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagevariable1‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ<fs_op>-cadocumentnumber. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagevariable2‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ<fs_op>-caamountintransactioncurrency‚ÄØ&&‚ÄØ'/'‚ÄØ&&‚ÄØ<fs_op>-transactioncurrency. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagevariable3‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ<fs_op>-casepaprenotificationnumber. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØls_messages-systemmessagevariable4‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ<fs_op>-casepaprenotifexecutiondate+6(2)‚ÄØ&&‚ÄØ'/'‚ÄØ&& 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ<fs_op>-casepaprenotifexecutiondate+4(2)‚ÄØ&&‚ÄØ'/'‚ÄØ&& 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ<fs_op>-casepaprenotifexecutiondate(4). 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØAPPEND‚ÄØls_messages‚ÄØ‚ÄØTO‚ÄØmessages. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØENDIF. 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØENDLOOP.‚ÄØ"‚ÄØAT‚ÄØcadocumentitemstobepayed 
 
‚ÄØ‚ÄØENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Re: SAP ChaRM: Prevent forwarding of transports after imp...
entry.content:
ChaRM itself cannot stop TMS from adding transports to the next system buffer because that behavior is controlled by the Transport Management System, not ChaRM.

What you can do is adjust your TMS configuration so transports are not automatically forwarded from Pre-Prod to Prod. This can be done by changing the transport route settings in STMS and disabling the auto-forward option.

Then, in ChaRM, you can include a custom action or PPF enhancement in the ‚ÄúApprove Production Import‚Äù step to add the transport manually to the Prod buffer using function module TMS_MGR_FORWARD_TR_REQUESTS.

So in short:

  • Control the auto-forward behavior in STMS.

  • Use a ChaRM action enhancement to add the transport to the Prod buffer only after approval.

entry.title: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom handlers CAP Node.js
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
Can you please help me with the difference between the events CREATE and INSERT? When should I use each one, and what is the best practice? Also, what is the standard sequence of invocation? Based on my debugging, it appears that whichever event handler is implemented first is the one invoked first.

this.before('CREATE', Properties, async (req) => {
}

this.before('INSERT', Properties, async (req) => {
}

Best regards,
Ramjee Korada

entry.title: Re: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom...
entry.content:
In CAP, CREATE is the generic event that covers both INSERT and UPSERT operations. When you create a record through standard CAP APIs (for example using POST /entity), the framework triggers the CREATE event first.

INSERT is more specific and is only triggered when the operation is explicitly an insert into the database.

So in sequence, if both are implemented, CREATE runs before INSERT.
Use CREATE when you want logic to run for all create-type operations, and INSERT when you need something to happen only during a pure insert to the database table.

In practice, most developers use CREATE for validation or preprocessing and reserve INSERT for low-level data manipulation before persistence.

entry.title: Re: Mass Assets Scrapping - With posting on a specific ac...
entry.content:
You cannot directly change the Gain or Loss G/L accounts during posting in ABAVN, since those accounts are picked up automatically from the account determination in AO90.

If you need to post to a different G/L account for this specific scrapping run, there are a few options:

  1. Temporary change in AO90 ‚Äì Update the account determination for the relevant asset class to point to your specific G/L account, run the mass scrapping, and then revert the change.

  2. Use a separate transaction type ‚Äì Create a new transaction type for scrapping and assign it to the G/L account you want in AO90. This is the cleaner and more controlled way if this requirement will repeat.

  3. Custom program or LSMW ‚Äì For mass scrapping of more than 100 assets, you can use BDC/LSMW on ABAVN or a custom report based on BAPI_ASSET_RETIREMENT_POST to automate the process.

If this is a one-time activity, option 1 is fine. If it will be used regularly, option 2 is recommended so that the posting logic stays consistent.

entry.title: LE_SHP_DELIVERY_PROC FINAL_DELIVERY_CHECK / SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE
entry.content:
I have a requirement to validate the item level of Delivery creation.

I have implemented LE_SHP_DELIVERY_PROC, and completed validation in the FINAL_DELIVERY_CHECK. In this case I want to allow the delivery to create, however depending on the checks, certain items need to be removed from the newly created Delivery.

I have achieved this by marking items in save_document_prepare with updkz = 'D'. This portion works as expected. And if my end result is that a delivery will not be created, this also works.

My challenge is, in the event that the delivery is still created (has valid lines), my status tables are not reverting properly.

XVBUP is read only in the BADi, and if I do a force status update during save_document_prepare it proceeds to try to update in the following location:

SAPMV50A
FV50XF0B_CALL_BADI_SAVE_DOC_PR
CALL_BADI_SAVE_DOC_PREP

Here if lf_force_status_update is set to true the system loops through the changes to the delivery.

On finding a line item marked as delete (updkz eq 'D') it calls FM RV_XVBUP_DELETE.

This function module will remove the 'delivery' entry from xvbup, however it leaves the original predecessor order source marked as updkz 'U' with all the status flags set as if the delivery were actually created.

What am I missing? I've tried to make it as deleted during the change_delivery_item, however I need the full scope of the delivery in memory, so I have to wait for change_delivery_item to trigger a second time (IF_FLAG_NEW_ITEM EQ abap_false).

I will note that in testing this seems to work if I set the deletion flag in change_delivery_item when IF_FLAG_NEW_ITEM eq abap_true, however I don't have the full delivery in scope when the new item flag is true.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Depreciation Keys - Reducing Balance Method
entry.content:
In the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the depreciation logic and percentage rates are controlled through configuration via Expert Configuration since you cannot directly create or modify multi-level methods in the standard app.

If your client needs specific reducing balance rates like 33.33%, 13.33%, or 26.7%, you can request this setup through Expert Configuration by creating a new depreciation key that uses the Declining Balance Method with those custom percentages.

The standard content only provides a limited set of rate combinations for reducing balance, so when you need anything outside those values, SAP expects you to go through SAP Cloud Experts or the CBC (Configuration Environment) to have those rates modeled.

In short:

  • You cannot add new multi-level methods directly.

  • You can get your required percentages by creating new depreciation keys via Expert Configuration.

  • If needed, raise an SAP configuration request to have those methods added through CBC with support from SAP.

entry.title: Re: Cross-Company Code Cost Allocation and Cost Center Tr...
entry.content:
Yes, cross-company allocations are supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, but only through the Universal Allocation framework.

1. Cost Allocation Between Company Codes

You can perform cost assessments and distributions across company codes as long as both company codes belong to the same Controlling Area. The key scope item to activate is 2QL ‚Äì Universal Allocation.

Use the Manage Allocation Cycles ‚Äì Actual and Run Allocations Fiori apps to set up and execute the cycles. In your cycle, you can select cost centers from different company codes as senders and receivers.

2. Cost Center Transfer Between Company Codes

Yes, cost transfers between cost centers in different company codes are possible in the same controlling area using the same scope item (2QL). The same Fiori apps are used here as well.

Notes and Best Practices

  • Make sure all involved company codes share the same Controlling Area and Currency setup.

  • Intercompany postings will automatically generate the proper accounting entries in both company codes.

  • Test the allocation setup carefully because the integration with Financial Accounting is strict in Public Edition.

So in short, you are on the right track. Use scope item 2QL, and the Manage Allocation Cycles app is indeed the correct tool.

entry.title: Re: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom...

entry.title: Re: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom...
entry.content:
Hi Ramjee,

You can check the official CAP documentation here:
üëâ https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/node.js/events

The docs explain the different event types such as CREATE, READ, UPDATE, DELETE, and custom events. However, CAP does not guarantee a fixed order of execution when multiple handlers (like CREATE and INSERT) are implemented for the same entity.

From practical experience, CREATE is the higher-level event that wraps the insert logic, and the order of execution you see is often due to how the handlers are registered in code, not a defined framework rule.

So the best practice is to use CREATE for general logic and reserve INSERT only for database-level customization.

entry.title: Re: How to change the name of a standard field in the pur...
entry.content:
Good day @Hichem_Rahmani 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more information.

Key User Adaptation ‚Äì Read, Write Translations, Translating UI Changes, App Variants: All You Need to Know Using App Variants, Maintain Translations, Something Isn‚Äôt Working like It Should?,

To summarise, it is important to note that the label change in Adapt UI applies globally and not per language. Based on your requirements, the easiest way to achieve language specific behaviour and remain clean-core compatible is to create separate app variants per language and assign them through business roles.

Alternatively, if you prefer using Maintain Translations, I suggest you revert the label to standard, then regenerate the translation file, and enter the French translation under the <target lang=‚Äùfr‚Äù> section before you publish it.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

We would like for all users to have the same "My Home" initial layout, is this possible? We do not want to ever see the "Nothing here yet?" page. 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Fiori Pages and Spaces, pre-determined "My Home" with...
entry.content:
My Home is a user-specific resource that stores data in the personalization layer. There is no way to set a default option for all users in the current product. 

As an alternative, you can disable My Home and then set a desired "default" Space that would be first in the list for all users.

3549893 - Setting "Show My Home" as False for All Users in SAP Fiori Launchpad Space Mode

3012443 - SAP Fiori Spaces: How to sort spaces via technical keys

If you would like to submit a feature request for this, please see the following:

2469897 - How to submit a feature request for Fiori launchpad

Thanks,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAFT JPK_KR_PD configuration
entry.content:
Good day @Erwan_Prigent 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more details.

Mapping G/L Accounts to Financial Tags and Income Tax Tags, SAF-T Accounting Ledgers PD (SAF-T JPK_KR_PD),  SAF-T JPK_VAT with Declaration (JPK_V7M), Poland-Specific Settings

The summary is, based on my experience, it is advisable to only use alternative financial tag when you have a single G/L account that serves multiple reporting context for example partial operational vs. adjustment postings. It will allow dual classification for SAF-T without duplication G/L accounts. For standard accounts without consistent usage, leave the field blank.

When you want partially Tax-relevant invoice, it is advisable to post separate line items. One for the deductible portion and another for the non-deductible portion. Make sure each line item has its respective tax code and tag, that ensure both are correctly reflected in the JPK_KR_PD report.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Joule - Document Grounding with Build Workzone Advanced
entry.content:
Setting up Document Grounding for Build Workzone Advanced

Document grounding is a foundational Joule capability which can provide more comprehensive responses by drawing from business documents located in SAP and third-party repositories.

Grounding is a service designed to handle data-related tasks, such as grounding and retrieval, using vector databases. It provides specialized data retrieval through these databases, grounding the retrieval process with your own external and context-relevant data. Grounding combines generative AI capabilities with the ability to use real-time, precise data to improve decision-making and business operations for specific AI-driven business solutions.

Grounding converts user provided documents into vector representations which are stored as a database. The indexing pipeline preprocesses unstructured and semi structured data into chunks and embeddings and the retrieval pipeline takes incoming user queries and converts them into vector representations. The query vectors are used to search the database and retrieval relevant information.

Prerequisites: Before triggering the setup process, make sure that you‚Äôve purchased the AI Unit SKU (8019164) OR AI Units SKU - 8018592. After you‚Äôve done so, the entitlements for document grounding are automatically added to your global account. Validate if you can see the entitlement "Document Grounding" in Global Account -> Service Assignment area.

Document Grounding now supports two authentication mechanisms. Please check the Configure Access from SAP BTP before you start your setup.

This blog focuses on setting up Document Grounding with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If you need to setup Document Grounding for Microsoft Sharepoint, please refer to this blog written by Nagesh: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-getting-started-with-document-grounding-setup-guide/ba-p/13739501

Document types supported for SAP Build Workzone, advanced edition: Blog posts, DOCX, JPEG, JPG, JSON, Knowledge base articles, PDF, PNG, PPTX, TIFF, TXT, Wiki pages (https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/integrating-joule-with-sap/set-up-document-grounding)

 

Setup Steps

Step 1: Enable Document Grounding capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition

Step 2: Enable Document Grounding for Workspaces & Sub-Workspaces in Work Zone Advanced

Step 3: Explore Content Locations ‚Äî Blogs, Wikis, and Documents for Grounding

Step 4: Use an Existing Joule Subaccount or Create a New One to Set Up Document Grounding

Step 5: Create Certificate and RSA Key Files

Step 6: Run cURL commands to setup Document Grounding pipelines

Step 7: Verify and Test Joule

Step 8: Appendix

 

Step 1: Enable Document Grounding capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition

Navigate to SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition ‚Üí App Finder ‚Üí Administration Console.

In the Administration Console, go to External Integrations ‚Üí OAuth Clients, and click Add OAuth Client.

Enter a Name and an Integration URL for the OAuth client.

Note: The Integration URL is not validated, so you can enter any placeholder value.

After saving the OAuth Client, click View to display the Client Key and Client Secret.
Copy these values. You will need them later during the integration setup.

OAuth Client Key: dgkey123456

OAuth Client Secret: dgsecretabcdef

Navigate to Administration Console ‚Üí Feature Enablement ‚Üí Features
Enable the Document Grounding Integration feature, and then select the OAuth Client you created in the previous step.

From the Administration Console ‚Üí Overview page, copy the DWS URL.
For example: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com

 

Step 2: Enable Document Grounding for Workspaces & Sub-Workspaces in Work Zone Advanced

Workspaces and Sub-Workspaces both need to be enabled for Document Grounding. Selecting only the "Workspace" does not automatically enable Document Grounding in "Sub-Workspaces"

Navigate to SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition ‚Üí Workspaces ‚Üí New Workspace, and select Public Workspace.

Note: Document Grounding is supported only for Public Workspaces. If you have an existing Private Workspace, you can convert it to a Public Workspace from the Workspace Admin Settings.

In the workspace, navigate to Workspace Admin Settings ‚Üí Edit Workspace.

Select the checkbox for Document Grounding to enable grounding for the workspace and then click Save

Note: If your setup includes a Sub-Workspace, make sure to enable Document Grounding there as well.
Enabling it at the main Workspace level does not automatically activate it for any Sub-Workspaces.

You can also manage Document Grounding across all workspaces by navigating to SAP Build Work Zone ‚Üí Administration Console ‚Üí Workspaces.

 

Step 3: Explore Content Locations ‚Äî Blogs, Wikis, and Documents for Grounding

Documents in SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition can be uploaded as individual files or referenced from other content areas such as Blogs, Wikis, and Knowledge Base articles.
In these cases, the entire page or article is treated as grounding content. All such sources are indexed and leveraged by Joule to provide accurate, context-aware responses based on your organization‚Äôs information.

3.a Content / Files:
In your workspace, go to Content to view existing files or upload new documents that will be used for document grounding.

3.b Knowledge Base:
In your workspace, go to Knowledge Base to create and manage knowledge base articles that can be used for document grounding.

3.c Blog or Wiki:
In the Content area, click Create to add a new Blog or Wiki page. These pages will be indexed and used as grounding content.

 

Step 4: Use an Existing Joule Subaccount or Create a New One to Set Up Document Grounding

Document Grounding must be configured in the same subaccount where Joule (or Unified Joule) is enabled.
Select the subaccount where Joule is already set up and verify that it is hosted in a supported region.

AWS: ap10 ‚Äì Australia (Sydney), ap11 ‚Äì Asia Pacific (Singapore), eu10 ‚Äì Europe (Frankfurt), eu11 ‚Äì Europe (Frankfurt, EU Access), jp10 ‚Äì Japan (Tokyo), us10 ‚Äì US East (VA)
Google Cloud: ap30 ‚Äì Australia (Sydney), eu30 ‚Äì Europe (Frankfurt), us30 ‚Äì US Central (IA)
Microsoft Azure: ap20 ‚Äì Australia (Sydney), eu20 ‚Äì Europe (Netherlands), us21 ‚Äì US East (VA)

For the latest list of supported regions, refer to the official documentation: Supported Regions for Document Grounding

 
4.a Setup for Document Grounding, If Unified Joule Already Exists: Adding Document Grounding to an existing Joule setup

  1. Navigate to your Subaccount.

  2. Go to Entitlements ‚Üí Add.

  3. Search for and add Document Grounding.

 
4.b Setup for Document Grounding, If Setting Up Unified Joule for the First Time: Adding Document Grounding during a new Joule setup

  1. Create a new Subaccount.

  2. In the Subaccount Overview page, enable Cloud Foundry.

  3. After Cloud Foundry is enabled, return to the Overview page and create a new space.

  4. Navigate to Trust Configuration ‚Üí Establish Trust to set up trust with Cloud Identity Services (CIS/IAS).

  5. Go to Entitlements ‚Üí Edit ‚Üí Add Service Plans, and add service plans for both Joule and Document Grounding.

  6. From your Global Account, open Boosters ‚Üí select Setting Up Joule Booster ‚Üí click Start.

  7. Choose your subaccount and proceed through the steps by selecting Next Step. You do not need to select any products, as this is a new setup without existing integrations.

 

After completion of Step 4.a OR 4.b proceed to create a Destination

 

4.c Create Destination

In your Joule Subaccount, navigate to Destinations ‚Üí Create ‚Üí From Scratch. Enter a Name for the destination. Add the values provided below

Name: HGDGBWZ924 (You can have any name)

Property

Value

URL

The URL is https://<DWS URL>/api/v1/dg-pipeline/metadata

Check DWS URL in the BWZ Advanced -> Admin Console -> Overview

E.g: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com/api/v1/dg-pipeline/metadata

Type

HTTP

Proxy Type

Internet

Authentication

OAuth2ClientCredentials

Client ID

Enter the value of the OAuth client Key from BWZ Advanced created in Step 1

OAuth Client Key: dgkey123456

Client Secret

Enter the value of the OAuth client Secret from BWZ Advanced created in Step 1

OAuth Client Secret: dgsecretabcdef

Token Service URL Type

Dedicated

Token Service URL

Enter your <DWS URL>/api/v1/auth/token

E.g: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com/api/v1/auth/token

Check DWS URL in the BWZ Advanced -> Admin Console -> Overview

Additional Properties

(Click New Property and manually add these properties to the destination)

HTML5.DynamicDestination

true

SetXForwardedHeaders

false

HTML5.SetXForwardedHeaders

false

4.d Create Document Grounding Service Instance

In your Joule Subaccount, go to Service Marketplace ‚Üí Document Grounding ‚Üí Create.

  • Select Runtime Environment: Other

  • Enter an Instance Name: for example, groundingcli

  • Click Create

Create a Service Binding for the Document Grounding Instance

In your Subaccount, navigate to Instances & Subscriptions ‚Üí Instances
Select your Document Grounding Service Instance, then proceed to "Create Service Binding"

Enter a Binding Name, for example: groundingkey, and click Create

Copy the mTLS Document Grounding Service Binding URL (MTLS URL) for later use.

E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

4.e Create Cloud Identity Services Instance

In your Subaccount, navigate to Services ‚Üí Service Marketplace ‚Üí Cloud Identity Services ‚Üí Create.

  • Plan: application

  • Runtime Environment: Other

  • Instance Name: groundingCIS

Then click Next (do not click Create yet).

In the Parameters section, enter the following JSON ‚Äî replacing <doc-grounding-instance-name> with the Document Grounding Service Instance Name you created earlier (E.g: groundingcli) ‚Äî and then click Create.

{
   "consumed-services":[
      {
         "service-instance-name":"<doc-grounding-instance-name>"
      }
   ]
}

In your Subaccount, navigate to Instances & Subscriptions ‚Üí Instances
Select your Cloud Identity Services Instance, then proceed to "Create Service Binding"

Enter a Service Binding Name, for example: cisSK, and provide the following parameters. Then click Create

{
    "credential-type": "X509_GENERATED",
    "validity": 365,
    "validity-type": "DAYS"
}

Download the Service Binding file for the Cloud Identity Services instance.

 

Step 5: Create Certificate and RSA Key Files

You‚Äôll now create two files required for secure communication between Document Grounding and Cloud Identity Services (CIS).

Open the CIS Service Binding file and copy the following values:

  • clientid

  • authorization_endpoint

Then, update the authorization_endpoint by replacing /oauth2/authorize with /oauth2/token

E.g: clientid: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

E.g: authorization_endpoint: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

Copy the certificates (there are 2 certificates) from the CIS Service Binding file (Starting with "----BEGIN CERTIFICATE---- to ----End CERTIFICATE----" and RSA key (Starting with ----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY---- to ----END RSA PRIVATE KEY----) to VSCode (or Notepad++)

In VSCode press Ctrl+H and enter "\n" in Find and "," in Replace. Select "Match Case" and click "Replace all"

After that enter "," in Find and "\n" in Replace. Select "Match Case" and "Use Regular Expression" and click "Replace all"

You will see "2 Certificates" and "1 RSA Key" similar to the screenshot below

  • Save the two certificates into a single file and save it as a .crt file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Save the RSA private key as a .key file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.key

 

Step 6: Run cURL commands to setup Document Grounding pipelines

In this step, you‚Äôll use Bruno (or any API client such as Postman) to execute cURL commands that create and configure Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount.
These pipelines establish the connection between SAP Build Work Zone content and the Document Grounding service.

6.a Install Bruno and Create a Collection

Install Bruno: Download and install the Bruno API Client.

Open Bruno and click Create Collection

Provide a Name for the collection, for example: DGcollection, choose a Location to save it, and click Create.

Before proceeding, ensure you have the following two URLs ready:

  • IAS URL (of Joule Subaccount): https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  • Document Grounding Service Binding URL (mTLS): mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

In Bruno, perform the following steps:

  1. Select your collection (DGcollection).

  2. Go to Client Certificates.

  3. For the Domain, enter your IAS URL ‚Äî abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  4. Select the Certificate File (DocumentGrounding.crt) and the Key File (DocumentGrounding.key).

  5. Click Add to save the configuration.

Repeat the same process for the Document Grounding Service Binding URL:

  • Domain: mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

  • Certificate File: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Key File: DocumentGrounding.key

Click Add to save the configuration.

6.b Create a Bearer Token

In this step, you‚Äôll generate an OAuth 2.0 bearer token to authenticate subsequent API calls for creating Document Grounding pipelines.

  • In Bruno, select your collection (DGcollection).

  • Click New Request and enter:

    • Name: Get Bearer Token

    • URL: Your CIS URL followed by /oauth2/token
      Example: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

  • Click Create.

Add Parameters

  • client_id: (from your Cloud Identity Services binding file cisSK.json) Example: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

  • grant_type: client_credentials

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • accept: application/json

Change the method from GET to POST, click Save, then click the ‚Üí (Send) button.

You will receive a response similar to the example below.
Copy the access_token, as it will be used in the next step to create the Document Grounding Pipeline

{
  "access_token": "xyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyz",
  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "expires_in": 3600
}

üí°Tip: The bearer token is temporary ‚Äî it expires after the duration shown in expires_in (in seconds).
You‚Äôll need to generate a new access token each time you perform Document Grounding operations in the future (for example, to create, update, or refresh pipelines)

 

6.c Create a Pipeline

In Bruno, click New Request under your DGcollection.

  • Method: POST

  • URL: Your mTLS URL from the Document Grounding Service Binding, followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
    Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

  • Click Create.

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/json

  • Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>
    Example: Bearer eyJqa3UiOiJ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.odHRwczovL2F6cjJpe

Add Body

  • Change the Body type to JSON and paste the following:

  • The destination is the name of the "Destination" created in your Joule subaccount" (Step 4.c)
{
  "type": "WorkZone",
  "metadata": {
    "destination": "HGDGBWZ924"
  }
}

Click Save, then click ‚Üí (Send) to execute the request

If the request is successful, the response will display a pipelineId.
This confirms that the Document Grounding Pipeline has been successfully created and linked to your SAP Build Work Zone workspace. Copy the pipelineId from the response (E.g:  pipelineId: aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44)

 

Setup Complete

Your Document Grounding setup is now complete.
All configurations between SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition, Joule, and Document Grounding have been successfully established.

Beyond the initial setup, you can perform additional operations using Bruno or cURL, such as:

  • Get all pipelines ‚Äì retrieve a list of existing Document Grounding pipelines.

  • Delete a pipeline ‚Äì remove an inactive or obsolete pipeline.

  • Trigger a pipeline ‚Äì manually refresh or re-index workspace content.

These advanced operations will be detailed in the Appendix section in the end.

 

Step 7: Verify and Test Joule

Now that the setup is complete, it‚Äôs time to test Joule. If you already have Unified Joule set up, you can launch Joule directly from the application. (E.g: Successfactors, Ariba, S/4 Private Cloud, IBP etc.)

If this is a new setup, launch Joule by navigating to Subaccounts ‚Üí Instances & Subscriptions ‚Üí Joule Instance, click the instance name to open it, and when you see ‚ÄúThe service is up and running,‚Äù copy the URL and append /joule ‚Äî for example: https://rigunifiedjoule-test-sge254ddd.eu10.sapdas.cloud.sap/joule

Before launching Joule, create a Role Collection under Subaccount ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Role Collections, add the end_user role, assign the role collection to your user in Subaccount ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Users.


Ask Joule questions related to your Work Zone content (files, wikis, blogs, or knowledge base articles) that were included in the grounding configuration. If everything is working correctly, Joule should return context-aware answers derived from your organization‚Äôs grounded documents.

 

Step 8: Appendix

After completing the setup, you can manage and maintain your Document Grounding pipelines using additional API operations in Bruno or cURL. These include viewing all existing pipelines, deleting or re-creating a pipeline, manually triggering executions, and checking their status.

 

8.a. Get All Pipelines

Use a GET request to retrieve all existing Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount. This allows you to verify which pipelines are active and view their associated destinations.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Get All Pipelines
Enter the MTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

Add headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Sendüòû You will see all existing pipelines
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Note: You need to get a new Bearer token if the previous token is expired. Check step 6.2 to get a new Bearer token

8.b. Delete a Pipeline

Use a DELETE request with the specific pipelineId to remove a pipeline that‚Äôs no longer needed or was incorrectly configured.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Delete Pipeline.

Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<pipelineId>
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44

Add headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
content-type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
Once executed, the pipeline with the given ID will be deleted successfully

8.c. Trigger a Pipeline

Use a POST request to manually trigger a pipeline execution. This can reindex or update metadata for all grounded documents in the selected pipeline.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Trigger Pipeline
Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger

Add Body

{
  "pipelineId": "aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44",
  "metadataOnly": false
}

Add Headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Once executed, the pipeline will start executing.

8.d. Check Pipeline Execution/Grounding Status of the documents

To check status of individual documents (files, wiki, knowledge article etc.)

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) ‚Üí click New Request ‚Üí name it Check Grounding Status.
URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/documents
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/documents

Add Headers, save, and click ‚Üí (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

8.e. Check Pipeline Status & Total executions

Replicate steps from 8.d and use "status" and "executions" instead of "documents" in the URL. You will get final status or total number of executions of the pipeline 

URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/status OR executions

Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/status
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/executions

entry.title: Flexible workflow for Supplier Invoice SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL don't work
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am using Flexible workflow for Supplier Invoice and for that I am implementing the custum logics  SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF and SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL because we need create a new condition criteria for document type.  
This is my code for SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF  I think it's working correctly because the new condition appearing as an additional option in the Start Conditions dropdown in the Flexible Workflow app:

CONSTANTS co_id TYPE if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>ty_condition_id VALUE 'DTP' ##NO_TEXT.

ct_condition = VALUE #(
  ( id = co_id
     subject = 'Accounting Document Type is'(001) " Texto traducible (mant√©n 001 en TEXT ELEMENTS)
    type = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_condtype-start_step )
).

" Define Parameters
ct_parameter = VALUE #(
   ( id = co_id
     name = 'AccountingDocumentType' ##NO_TEXT " No traducir (clave t√©cnica)
     shorttext = 'Document Type'(002) " Texto corto traducible
     xsd_type = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_xstype-string
     mandatory = abap_true )
).

I think the problem is SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL because when I create a workflow with this condition and post an invoice that meets the condition, the workflow doesn't trigger. However, if I use the workflow with the default configured conditions, it works.

This is my code for SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL. If you could help me evaluate it to see if there are any errors, I would appreciate it.

CONSTANTS co_id TYPE if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>ty_condition_id VALUE 'DTP' ##NO_TEXT.

cv_is_true = abap_false.

IF is_condition-condition_id <> co_id.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
ENDIF.

IF iv_is_draft = abap_true.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
ENDIF.

READ TABLE it_parameter_value INTO DATA(ls_param_value) INDEX 1.
IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_param_value-value IS INITIAL.

RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
ENDIF.

DATA(lv_expected_doc_type) = ls_param_value-value.

DATA: lv_bukrs TYPE string,
lv_belnr TYPE string,
lv_gjahr TYPE string.

CLEAR: lv_bukrs, lv_belnr, lv_gjahr.

DATA lt_parts TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string WITH EMPTY KEY.
FIELD-SYMBOLS <p> TYPE string.

DO 6 TIMES.
ASSIGN COMPONENT |sont_key_part_{ sy-index }| OF STRUCTURE is_sap_object_node_type TO <p>.
IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <p> IS ASSIGNED AND <p> IS NOT INITIAL.
APPEND <p> TO lt_parts.
ENDIF.
ENDDO.

LOOP AT lt_parts ASSIGNING <p>.
DATA(lv_key) = <p>.
CONDENSE lv_key NO-GAPS.

IF lv_gjahr IS INITIAL
AND strlen( lv_key ) = 4
AND lv_key CO '0123456789'.
lv_gjahr = lv_key.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

IF lv_belnr IS INITIAL
AND strlen( lv_key ) = 10
AND lv_key CO '0123456789'.
lv_belnr = lv_key.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

IF lv_bukrs IS INITIAL
AND strlen( lv_key ) = 4
AND lv_key <> lv_gjahr.
lv_bukrs = lv_key.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

IF lv_belnr IS INITIAL OR lv_gjahr IS INITIAL.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
ENDIF.

lv_belnr = |{ lv_belnr ALPHA = IN }|.

DATA lv_actual_doc_type TYPE string.
CLEAR lv_actual_doc_type.

TRY.
IF lv_bukrs IS INITIAL.
SELECT SINGLE CompanyCode, AccountingDocumentType
FROM I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01
WHERE SupplierInvoice = @LV_belnr
AND FiscalYear = @LV_gjahr
INTO (@lv_bukrs, @LV_actual_doc_type).
ELSE.
SELECT SINGLE AccountingDocumentType
FROM I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01
WHERE CompanyCode = @LV_bukrs
AND SupplierInvoice = @LV_belnr
AND FiscalYear = @LV_gjahr
INTO @LV_actual_doc_type.
ENDIF.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx_supinv) ##CATCH_ALL.
CLEAR: lv_bukrs, lv_actual_doc_type.
ENDTRY.

IF lv_actual_doc_type IS INITIAL.
TRY.
SELECT SINGLE AccountingDocumentType
FROM I_JournalEntry
WHERE AccountingDocument = @LV_belnr
AND FiscalYear = @LV_gjahr
INTO @LV_actual_doc_type.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx_je) ##CATCH_ALL.
CLEAR lv_actual_doc_type.
ENDTRY.
ENDIF.

IF lv_actual_doc_type IS INITIAL.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
ENDIF.

DATA(lv_up_expected) = lv_expected_doc_type.
DATA(lv_up_actual) = lv_actual_doc_type.

TRANSLATE: lv_up_expected TO UPPER CASE,
lv_up_actual TO UPPER CASE.

IF lv_up_actual = lv_up_expected.
cv_is_true = abap_true.
ENDIF.

This is quite strange, and I would like to know why this is happening and if there is a solution.
Below is the code I'm using

  //Update
  foreach (LineDetail rdr1 in addedDetails)
  {
      int tl = _initLines.IndexOf((int)rdr1.LineNum);
      if (tl >= 0)
      {
          dts.Lines.SetCurrentLine(tl);
          if (dts.Lines.LineStatus == BoStatus.bost_Open)
          {
              dts.Lines.ItemCode = rdr1.ItemCode.Replace("\", "‚ñ†");
              dts.Lines.ItemDescription = rdr1.Dscription;
              dts.Lines.Quantity = System.Convert.ToDouble(rdr1.Quantity);

              dts.Lines.Currency = model.DocCur;
          }
         
      }
      // ...
      var res = dts.Update();
  }

entry.title: Re: How to handle different fiscal year variants and fixe...
entry.content:
HI @yahaha ,

-Different fiscal year variants ‚Üí must use separate company codes and separate controlling areas.
-Fixed asset depreciation operates independently per company code, so January recalculation in Company B will never affect Company A.
-Maintain consistent depreciation area structure, but allow local GAAP differences per CoCd.
-Use Group Reporting to consolidate results across both fiscal years.

 

Topic / AreaCompany A (Japan)Company B (China)SAP Rule / BehaviorRecommended Best Practice
Fiscal Year VariantApril‚ÄìMarchJanuary‚ÄìDecemberCompany code level ‚Üí cannot mix within same CoCd‚úÖ Separate company codes are required
Local GAAPJP GAAPCN GAAPDifferent valuation rules require separate depreciation areas‚úÖ Create local GAAP depreciation area per CoCd
Controlling Area (CO)Needs FY April‚ÄìMarchNeeds FY January‚ÄìDecemberAll CoCds in a CO area must share fiscal year variant‚úÖ Two controlling areas (one per company code)
Cost Centers / Internal OrdersLocal to CoCd ALocal to CoCd BCO objects cannot span across CO areas‚úÖ Keep CO objects separate; consolidate at group level
Asset Accounting Fiscal YearBased on CoCd A FYBased on CoCd B FYDepreciation calculated per company code‚úÖ No conflict ‚Äî system handles each CoCd independently
Useful Life / APC Changes (FI-AA)January = period 10 (previous fiscal year)January = period 1 (new fiscal year)Changes affect only the specific CoCd‚Äôs asset values‚úÖ Safe ‚Äî recalculation in CoCd B does NOT impact CoCd A
Depreciation AreasJP GAAP (Area 01), Group GAAP (Area 10), Tax (Area XX)CN GAAP (Area 01), Group GAAP (Area 10), Tax (Area XX)Depreciation areas independent per CoCd‚úÖ Use identical structure but different keys/parameters
GL Posting for DepreciationFollows Japan FY periodsFollows China FY periodsPosting logic tied to CoCd FY‚úÖ No need for alignment; SAP posts separately
Cross-Company IntegrationNot possible for CONot possible for COCO cross-postings require same FY‚úÖ Perform consolidation using Group Reporting or financial statements
Legal & Localization RequirementsJapan localizationChina localizationLocal specifics are CoCd-specific‚úÖ Separate CoCds fully comply with local laws


If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: How to trace original cost document settled through W...
entry.content:
HI @SwapnilKaware ,

 

TopicDetails
Business RequirementBuild a custom report where user inputs Final Asset + Company Code and receives complete trace from Original Cost Document ‚Üí WBS ‚Üí AUC ‚Üí Final Asset
Why Standard Reports Are Not EnoughStandard reports (AR03, AW01N, CJ74, CJ76, CJI3, AIBU) show partial data only‚Äîno end-to-end linkage from GRN/SES ‚Üí WBS ‚Üí AUC ‚Üí Final Asset in a single report
Settlement Process FlowWBS Costs ‚Üí AUC (CJ88) ‚Üí Final Asset (CJ88 with CJIC-defined rules)
Key Tables Needed‚Ä¢ WBS Costs: ACDOCA, COSS, COSP, RSEG (SES), EKBE (GRN) ‚Ä¢ WBS ‚Üí AUC Settlement: ACDOCA (KOART = 'A', settlement docs), COBRA ‚Ä¢ AUC ‚Üí Final Asset Settlement: ACDOCA (Asset settlement lines), ANLP / ANLC ‚Ä¢ Asset Master: ANLA, ANLZ
Primary Linking Logic1. Final Asset ‚Üí find all settlement docs (ACDOCA) where sender is AUC 2. Identify AUC Asset from same settlement doc lines 3. From AUC, fetch settlement docs where sender is WBS 4. For sender WBS, fetch all original postings (GRN/SES/Invoice) via ACDOCA + EKBE + RSEG
Recommended Custom Report NameZWBS_AUC_FA_TRACE (or ZFA_AUC_WBS_TRACE)
Selection Criteria‚Ä¢ Company Code ‚Ä¢ Final Asset Number ‚Ä¢ Optional: Posting Date Range / Project / AUC
Output Columns (as required)Final Asset ‚Ä¢ Final Asset Desc ‚Ä¢ AUC Asset ‚Ä¢ AUC‚ÜíFA Settlement Doc ‚Ä¢ Posting Date ‚Ä¢ Settlement Amount ‚Ä¢ WBS Element ‚Ä¢ WBS Desc ‚Ä¢ WBS‚ÜíAUC Settlement Doc ‚Ä¢ Posting Date ‚Ä¢ GRN / SES Doc No ‚Ä¢ Posting Date ‚Ä¢ PO No ‚Ä¢ Vendor
Standard T-Codes Supporting Cross-CheckCJ74 (WBS Line Items), AIBU (Settlement), AW01N (Asset Explorer), CJI3 (WBS actual line items), CJ88 (Settlement)
Feasible Standard AlternativeNo single out-of-the-box SAP report provides a full chain; must be built as a custom CDS view + ALV Fiori report
Recommended Technical Approach (S/4HANA 2022)Build CDS stack: 1. CDS 1: Join Final Asset ‚Üî Settlement Docs (ACDOCA) 2. CDS 2: Join AUC ‚Üî WBS Settlement (ACDOCA + COBRA) 3. CDS 3: Original Cost Docs (ACDOCA + EKBE/RSEG/BKPF/BSEG) 4. CDS 4: Consume above via UNION/ASSOCIATIONS ‚Üí final composite view 5. Fiori app or custom ALV program for reporting
Performance ConsiderationsUse ACDOCA filters: ‚Ä¢ KOART (account type) ‚Ä¢ AWREF (asset sub number) ‚Ä¢ AWTYP/AWKEY for linking FI ‚Üî MM documents ‚Ä¢ OBJNR (WBS) for linking settlement sender
Expected OutcomeA single report that reconstructs the full flow: PO ‚Üí GRN/SES ‚Üí WBS ‚Üí AUC ‚Üí Final Asset with all financial + logistical traceability

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.

entry.title: Re: Delete a mission order
entry.content:
HI @ELOGEALAIN_SAHNGAKOUAKEP ,

 

TopicDetails
Error Message56146 ‚Äì ‚ÄúCancellation not possible because travel data exists for the same period.‚Äù
Cause in CloudMission order overlaps with one or more travel documents (Expense Report, Travel Plan, Approved Trip) for the same employee and period. Cloud enforces strict lifecycle rules, preventing cancellation.
Required Condition for Cancellation- No expense reports submitted- No travel plans exist- No trips approved or posted- No overlapping mission orders for the same period
Common Scenarios Causing Error 561461. Expense report already created/submitted2. Travel plan exists for the period3. Another mission order overlaps4. Trip approved and sent to accounting
Step-by-Step Resolution (Cloud Apps)1. Open ‚ÄúMy Travel & Expenses‚Äù or Travel Requests app2. Identify all travel documents overlapping with the mission order3. Cancel/Delete expense reports (if in Draft) or Withdraw (if submitted)4. Delete or Withdraw any Travel Plans5. Withdraw any approved trips (if possible)6. Retry mission order cancellation once all dependent documents are cleared
Workflow ReminderCloud enforces: Expense Report Cancellation ‚Üí Travel Request Withdrawal ‚Üí Mission Order Cancellation. Direct deletion is not possible.
Tips / Best Practices- Always check overlapping travel documents first- Ensure all status dependencies are cleared before attempting cancellation- Use the ‚ÄúTravel Overview‚Äù Fiori app to quickly identify blocking documents

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Error in Posting an Inbound Idoc in In-House Cash
entry.content:
HI @rajeev_uppal2 ,

 

TopicDetails
Error Message / Status56 ‚Äì ‚ÄúPartner Profile does not exist‚Äù
Module / ScenarioSAP In-House Cash (IHC) ‚Äì IDoc posting / payment processing
MeaningSystem cannot find a partner profile for the IDoc‚Äôs partner number, message type, and direction. Posting fails without it.
Root Causes1. Missing Partner Profile in WE20 (house bank, bank interface, external system)2. Incorrect Message Type (e.g., IHC_PAYEXT, PAYEXT)3. Wrong direction (inbound vs outbound mismatch)4. Logical system not assigned to partner profile
Resolution Steps1. Check IDoc details (WE02 / WE05) ‚Äì IDoc number, partner, message type, direction2. Maintain Partner Profile in WE20 ‚Äì create partner number, assign message type, partner type (LS/KU/LI)3. Ensure correct message type matches IDoc (e.g., IHC_PAYEXT)4. Verify sender/receiver logical system matches BD64 distribution model5. Test IDoc processing (BD87) after maintaining partner profile6. Verify success (IDoc status 53)
Best Practices- Maintain partner profiles in WE20 for all banks/logical systems- Verify message type and direction- Test first IDoc in WE19 before mass processing- Keep logical system names consistent for ALE / IDoc routing- Activate ports in WE21
Common Message Types in SAP IHC- Payment export to house bank / external system ‚Üí IHC_PAYEXT- Reverse payment / other IHC scenarios ‚Üí IHCPAYEXT- Bank statement inbound ‚Üí IHC_BANKSTAT

SAP Audit Management ‚Äì Mandatory Control Assignment

 

Requirement / ScenarioStandard SupportRecommended ApproachNotes / Comments
Make Control mandatory for all findings‚ùå Not standardUI adaptation (make Control field required)Simple, always-mandatory; cannot be conditional on status
Make Control mandatory based on audit status (e.g., Submit/Close)‚ùå Not standardBRF+ validation rule or custom Fiori/UI5 logicConditional enforcement possible using audit status
Enforce mandatory assignment at submission/closure‚ùå Not standardBRF+ rule or workflow checkEnsures users cannot submit/close without assigning control
Prevent bypass / enforce strict compliance‚ùå Not fully standardCombine UI adaptation + BRF+ validation + workflowProvides strongest enforcement mechanism
Optional workflow-based enforcementPartialApproval workflow can block submission if control missingWorks only during workflow step, not real-time field validation
Notes on BRF+Supports complex conditionsRequires configuration of rule triggered on Save / Submit / CloseCan check status and field value together
